Effects observed.Additional symptoms: Substantial reduction of dopamine uptake transporter (DAT) binding in the striatum, indicating a serious loss of presynaptic dopaminergic afferents

Family History.Phenotype of sibling: Clinically unaffected but showed reduced dopamine uptake when compared with a clinically unaffected brother

Sibling 2 (homozygous).Phenotype: Clinically unaffected but showed reduced dopamine uptake when compared with a clinically unaffected brother

Crystallography results.Stability of protein: A tendency towards decreased levels of the mutant protein when overexpressed in HEK293 or COS7 cells

Immunocytochemistry results.Location of protein in overexpressing ce: Homogenous nuclear and cytoplasmic staining in cells overexpressing wild-type DJ1
Immunocytochemistry results.Comparison with other mutations: Up to 80% of the cells expressing the recently described L166P mutation displayed a predominant nuclear localization of the mutant DJ1 protein
